title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against Falcons
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: DeMario Douglas achieved his first career 100-yard game, including a 58-yard catch, contributing to the Patriots' victory.
Drake Maye had two turnovers, which were exploited by the Falcons, but still delivered key throws despite six sacks.
Marcus Jones struggled with red-zone mismatches against Drake London, leading to 14 of the Falcons' 23 points.

title: Boston residents say they feel safer downtown compared to last year in new survey
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Survey by Downtown Boston Neighborhood Association shows only 33.7% feel 'less safe' downtown, down from 70.6% in 2024.
Public safety summit at Emerson Cutler Majestic Theatre discussed issues like drug use, road safety, and cleanliness.
Retail vacancies in downtown Boston are at their lowest post-COVID-19, attributed to increased perception of safety.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ 24-23 win over the Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots extend win streak to six games with a narrow 24-23 victory over the Falcons at Gillette Stadium.
Quarterback Drake Maye threw for 259 yards and two touchdowns but committed two turnovers against Atlanta.
Former Patriots kicker Parker Romo missed a crucial extra-point, helping New England secure the win.

title: 10 defendants, including a grandma, indicted in statewide sex trafficking case
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Ten defendants indicted in Massachusetts sex trafficking case involving multiple counties, says Attorney General Andrea Campbell's Office.
Gianni Martinez and grandmother Rosa Garcia of Lynn allegedly ran a trafficking operation, collecting payments from victims.
Indictments include charges of sexual servitude, rape, restraining order violations, and conspiracy, involving victims across four counties.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Miles Teller hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Miles Teller hosted 'Saturday Night Live' on Nov. 2, marking his second time as host.
Brandi Carlile returned as musical guest for her fourth appearance on 'SNL'.
Teller participated in a mock NYC mayoral debate during the political cold open skit.

title: Regulators are limiting a proposed Eversource rate hike in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts DPU partially denied Eversource's rate hike request, preventing a $45 million increase in revenue requirements.
Eversource's proposed rate hikes could have increased winter bills by about $41 monthly for 300,000 NSTAR customers.
Governor Maura Healey criticized the rate hikes as unaffordable, while Eversource warns of potentially higher future costs.

title: Wayland schools investigating after Black student targeted in racist locker room incident
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Wayland High School investigates racist locker room incident involving a Black student's jersey hung from a ceiling pipe.
Principal Allyson Mizoguchi condemns the act, noting it causes pain and has no place in the community.
Wayland Police and the DA's Office are working together to investigate, with community support from the Anti-Defamation League.

title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost to the Rockets 128-101, ending their three-game winning streak after playing their third game in four days.
Kevin Durant scored 26 points and the Rockets shot 65.5% from three-point range, thoroughly defeating the fatigued Celtics.
Baylor Scheierman led the Celtics with 17 points, while Chris Boucher's limited impact included only four points in 13 minutes.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots have elevated running back D'Ernest Johnson from the practice squad due to Rhamondre Stevenson's toe injury.
D'Ernest Johnson, a seven-year NFL veteran, could make his Patriots debut against the Atlanta Falcons on Sunday.
With Antonio Gibson out, TreVeyon Henderson and Terrell Jennings join Johnson in the depleted Patriots backfield.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov's new defensive partnership has improved the Boston Bruins' 5-on-5 performance.
The Bruins' defense reduced goals and high-danger chances after three consecutive wins with the McAvoy-Zadorov pairing.
Nikita Zadorov's size and physical style complement Charlie McAvoy's offensive play, strengthening Boston's defense.
